title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 703.7 - Amendment of records
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 703.7 - Amendment of records

State Regulations
(a) Within 30 business days of a request from a data subject for correction or
amendment of a record or personal information that is reasonably described and
that pertains to the data subject, the department shall: (1)
make the amendment or correction in whole
or in part and inform the data subject that, on request, such correction or
amendment will be provided to any person or governmental unit to which the
record or personal information has been or is disclosed; or
(2)
inform the data subject in writing of the
denial of the request to correct or amend the record, including the reasons
therefor and the name of the person to whom an appeal may be
directed. (b) A failure
to grant or deny access to records within five business days of the receipt of
a request or within 30 days of an acknowledgment of the receipt of a request, or a failure to respond to a request for amendment or correction of a record
within 30 business days of receipt of such a request, shall be construed as a
denial that may be appealed. Notes

R. & Regs. Tit. 12

703.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
